intro: Chamaemelum tinctorium, commonly known as Roman chamomile, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers with white centers. The plant has narrow, gray-green leaves and is often grown for its aromatic properties. It is well-known for its use in herbal medicine and as a source of essential oils. Chamaemelum tinctorium is also valued for its role in traditional dyeing practices due to the presence of flavonoids in its flowers.
